meanings.sent1: The fish will spawn in the river during the spring.
meanings.sent2: Salmon spawn in freshwater and then migrate to the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The frogs decided to spawn a surprise party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: Her idea to spawn a new business venture was met with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The flowers spawn seeds that will grow into new plants.

meanings.definition: Offspring or descendants, especially in large numbers
meanings.sent1: The frog laid her spawn in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The spawn of the famous actor were also talented performers.
meanings.sent3: The spawn of the dragon were causing mischief in the village.
meanings.sent4: The spawn of the oak tree covered the forest floor in acorns.
meanings.sent5: The fish eggs are the spawn of the fish.

meanings.definition: To give rise to or create something new or different
meanings.sent1: His innovative idea could spawn a whole new industry.
meanings.sent2: The new technology could spawn many opportunities for growth.
meanings.sent3: The chef's experiment in the kitchen might spawn a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected meeting could spawn a lifelong friendship.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity can spawn beautiful works of art.
